item.description:
Before signing up for this event, Please read the entire Write Up and understand and agree to the enclosed Liability Waiver.

Event Rating: Moderate
Distance: 6.0 Miles
Time Duration: 3.0 Hours
Blaze Orange: Recommended 



 

 

 

 

 

Description of hike :

Tillinghast Pond Management Area is located in West Greenwich and covers nearly 2,000 acres. It is the largest Nature Conservancy property in Rhode Island. The land is managed jointly by the Nature Conservancy, The RI DEM, and the Town of West Greenwich. Together with the Arcadia WMA, Wickaboxet WMA, and the Alton Jones Campus of URI, Tillinghast Pond is part of 40,000 acres of protected land in western RI.

We will be doing about a 6 mile hike, on land which is mostly flat and we will be hiking at a moderate pace. We will be doing portions of three loop trails, allowing us to do a 6 mile loop.

The Pond Loop goes around beautiful Tillinghast Pond. The Flintlock Loop goes through open woods that include a glacier “boulder garden”, a historic cemetery, and an old farmstead. The Coney Brook Loop features a forest restoration site, some glacial ridges, and the brook that the trail is named after.

As always bring sufficient water and snacks along for the hike and a good pair of hiking boots.

Directions to Parking:

From I-95, take Exit 5B - Route 102 North. Follow Route 102 for 3 miles, then turn left onto Plain Meetinghouse Road. Turn right at the intersection with Plain Road. Follow Plain Road for 1/2 mile to the parking lot on the right

 

Liability Waiver

As a condition of your voluntary participation in this activity you acknowledge and agree to the following: this activity involves inherent risks that can cause property damage, injury, illness, disability, and/or death to participants and/or others; you assume all risk associated with this activity; you are responsible for having the necessary knowledge, skills, abilities, clothing, and equipment to safely participate in this activity; you know and will follow the Hiker Responsibility Code described at www.hikesafe.com; the leader(s) of this activity are volunteers; and you for yourself, your heirs, executors, and administrators release, hold harmless, and indemnify the leader(s) and all members of this group from any and all claims for property damage, injury, illness, disability, and/or death - including those caused by negligence and/or other reasons.

Safety First!

group.name: Rhode Island Hiking Club " Walks and Rambles "

item.name: Tillinghast Pond Management Area
